com.todoroo.astrid.api
Class Filter

java.lang.Object
  com.todoroo.astrid.api.FilterListItem
      com.todoroo.astrid.api.Filter
All Implemented Interfaces:
android.os.Parcelable
Direct Known Subclasses:
FilterWithCustomIntent
public class Filter
extends FilterListItem

A FilterListFilter allows users to display tasks that have something in common.

A plug-in can expose new FilterListFilters to the system by responding to the com.todoroo.astrid.GET_FILTERS broadcast intent.

Author:
Tim Su

Field Detail

VALUE_NOW

public static final long VALUE_NOW
Constant for valuesForNewTasks to indicate the value should be replaced with the current time as long

See Also:
Constant Field Values

title

public java.lang.String title
Expanded title of this filter. This is displayed at the top of the screen when user is viewing this filter.

e.g "Tasks With Notes"

sqlQuery

public java.lang.String sqlQuery
PermaSql query for this filter. The query will be appended to the select statement after "SELECT fields FROM table %s". It is recommended that you use a QueryTemplate to construct your query.

Examples:

  • "WHERE completionDate = 0"
  • "INNER JOIN " + Constants.TABLE_METADATA + " ON metadata.task = tasks.id WHERE metadata.namespace = " + NAMESPACE + " AND metadata.key = 'a' AND metadata.value = 'b' GROUP BY tasks.id ORDER BY tasks.title"

valuesForNewTasks

public android.content.ContentValues valuesForNewTasks
Values to apply to a task when quick-adding a task from this filter. For example, when a user views tasks tagged 'ABC', the tasks they create should also be tagged 'ABC'. If set to null, no additional values will be stored for a task. Can use PermaSql

public static final android.os.Parcelable.Creator<Filter> CREATOR

Utility constructor for creating a Filter object

Parameters:
listingTitle - Title of this item as displayed on the lists page, e.g. Inbox
title - Expanded title of this filter when user is viewing this filter, e.g. Inbox (20 tasks)
sqlQuery - SQL query for this list (see sqlQuery for examples).
valuesForNewTasks - see #sqlForNewTasks
